summary: The Help Our Kelp Act of 2025 (H.R. 1124) mandates the Secretary of Commerce to establish a grant program to conserve, restore, and manage kelp forest ecosystems. The grants will be awarded to eligible entities, including fishing industry members, educational institutions, nonprofits, and government agencies, for projects focused on ecosystem resilience, kelp seeding, trophic structure recovery, and monitoring. The bill authorizes appropriations of $5 million annually from 2026-2030, with a minimum of $750,000 yearly allocated for grants to Indian Tribes.
